days.title: Why Keto
days.summary: Learn the metabolic context behind lowering carbs and using fat for fuel.
days.keyIdea: Keto lowers carbs to reduce glucose swings and encourage fat utilisation.
faqs: Is this medical advice? No—consult your doctor.
Track calories now? Not yet; start with carbs only.

days.title: Carb Targets
days.summary: Choose a daily carb cap that balances dietary adherence with energy needs.
days.keyIdea: Pick a sustainable daily carb cap: 20, 30, 40, or 50 g.
faqs: Which level? Start at 30 g; adjust in week 2.
Do fibre carbs count? You can use net carbs—just be consistent.

days.title: Sweeteners 101
days.summary: Compare natural and artificial sweeteners that fit ketosis.
days.keyIdea: Know which sweeteners have minimal glycaemic impact before adding them to your plan.
faqs: Are sugar alcohols OK? Most are, but note they can upset digestion in large amounts.
Is honey keto? Natural sugars still raise glucose; best saved for off-plan meals.

days.title: Pantry Reset
days.summary: Clear out high-carb staples and restock with keto-friendly basics.
days.keyIdea: Environment design makes adherence easier—stock what supports your goal.
faqs: Do I throw food away? Donate sealed goods or share with friends instead.
What about family? Keep shared shelves and label your go-to items.

days.title: Hidden Carbs
days.summary: Spot sneaky sugars in condiments, sauces, and packaged foods.
days.keyIdea: Read labels—carbs can hide in sauces, marinades, and processed meats.
faqs: Are zero-sugar drinks safe? Check for maltodextrin or tapioca starch fillers.
Do spices have carbs? Minimal, but blends may include sugar.

days.title: Hydration Essentials
days.summary: Dial in water intake to support energy and appetite control.
days.keyIdea: Hydration needs vary—monitor thirst, urine colour, and activity level.
faqs: How much water daily? Start around 30–35 ml per kg body weight.
Is sparkling water okay? Yes, unsweetened varieties are fine.

days.title: Electrolyte Balance
days.summary: Prioritize sodium, potassium, and magnesium for steady energy.
days.keyIdea: Electrolyte gaps drive fatigue—plan sources daily.
faqs: Do I need supplements? Start with food; supplement if symptoms persist.
Can I rely on sports drinks? Many add sugar—use low-carb formulas.

days.title: Breakfast Swaps
days.summary: Reinvent morning meals with low-carb, high-fat ideas.
days.keyIdea: Swap grains for protein and fibre to stabilise morning glucose.
faqs: Quick options? Eggs, yogurt, chia pudding, or smoked salmon plates.
What about coffee? Add fat-free sweeteners or heavy cream sparingly.

days.title: Lunch Planning
days.summary: Build portable keto lunches that keep you satisfied.
days.keyIdea: Combine protein, fat, and vegetables you enjoy for adherence.
faqs: Can I meal prep? Yes—batch cook proteins and assemble fresh.
Ideas for the office? Bento boxes with cheese, olives, nuts, greens.

days.title: Dinner Strategies
days.summary: Craft balanced evening meals the whole family enjoys.
days.keyIdea: Base dinners on protein and veggies; add fats with sauces and sides.
faqs: What about pasta? Try zucchini noodles or spaghetti squash.
Do I need dessert? Optional—berries with cream can fit your target.

days.title: Snack Prep
days.summary: Prepare quick bites that prevent cravings and over-snacking.
days.keyIdea: Plan snacks you actually like so you skip the vending machine.
faqs: Do I need snacks? Optional—use them to bridge long gaps.
Best travel options? Nuts, cheese sticks, jerky, hard-boiled eggs.

days.title: Eating Out
days.summary: Navigate restaurant menus and stay within your carb budget.
days.keyIdea: Scan menus in advance and anchor meals around protein.
faqs: What about sauces? Ask for them on the side.
Can I have dessert? Share a low-carb option or plan extra carbs.

days.title: Label Literacy
days.summary: Decode nutrition labels to confirm keto compliance.
days.keyIdea: Focus on total carbs, fibre, and serving size—marketing can mislead.
faqs: Net carbs or total? Pick one metric and track it consistently.
What about sugar alcohols? Track half if they upset digestion.

days.title: Macro Tracking
days.summary: Use simple tracking tools to monitor carbs, fat, and protein.
days.keyIdea: Use tracking selectively—helpful for data, optional long term.
faqs: Apps to use? Cronometer, MacroFactor, or manual notes.
Do I need to weigh food? In short bursts it improves accuracy.

days.title: Fiber Focus
days.summary: Increase low-carb fiber sources for gut and heart health.
days.keyIdea: Aim for fibre-rich veggies, seeds, and low-carb fruit to stay regular.
faqs: Do I need supplements? Start with chia, flax, leafy greens.
Constipation tips? Increase fibre gradually and hydrate.

days.title: Healthy Fats
days.summary: Choose quality fats that improve satiety and inflammation.
days.keyIdea: Prioritize minimally processed fats; vary sources for micronutrients.
faqs: Butter or oils? Use olive oil, avocado oil, grass-fed butter.
What about seed oils? Limit high-omega-6 oils when possible.

days.title: Protein Priorities
days.summary: Dial protein to protect lean mass and recovery.
days.keyIdea: Aim for 1.2–1.6 g/kg lean mass unless advised otherwise.
faqs: Is too much protein anti-keto? Gluconeogenesis is demand-driven—prioritise protein.
Plant-based options? Use tofu, tempeh, seitan if tolerated.

days.title: Meal Timing
days.summary: Experiment with fasting windows that suit your schedule.
days.keyIdea: Adjust meal timing based on hunger cues, not rigid rules.
faqs: Should I skip breakfast? Optional—monitor energy response.
Is OMAD required? No, use meal timing that fits your life.

days.title: Social Situations
days.summary: Plan ahead for gatherings and keep goals intact.
days.keyIdea: Communicate, bring shareable dishes, and set expectations early.
faqs: Do I announce my diet? Share when it helps logistics.
What if hosts insist? Thank them, keep portions small.

days.title: Dessert Makeovers
days.summary: Satisfy sweet cravings with low-carb desserts.
days.keyIdea: Plan desserts deliberately to avoid impulse choices.
faqs: Can I use fruit? Berries fit most carb budgets.
What about chocolate? Choose 85% and above.

days.title: Plateau Busting
days.summary: Adjust macros and habits when progress stalls.
days.keyIdea: Review intake, stress, sleep, and activity before drastic changes.
faqs: Should I lower carbs more? First audit adherence—then adjust.
Do I need refeeds? Optional—monitor how your body responds.

days.title: Sleep & Recovery
days.summary: Support hormones and energy with rest-first routines.
days.keyIdea: Prioritise 7–9 hours of quality sleep to stabilise appetite and glucose.
faqs: How to improve sleep? Keep a consistent schedule and limit screens before bed.
Is melatonin OK? Low-dose, short-term use can help—check with your doctor.

days.title: Workout Fueling
days.summary: Match activity levels with targeted carb timing.
days.keyIdea: Train mostly fuelled by fat, but use targeted carbs for high-intensity work.
faqs: Do I need pre-workout carbs? Optional—experiment with 10–15 g net carbs if intensity drops.
Post-workout meals? Prioritise protein plus vegetables and healthy fats.

days.title: Mindful Eating
days.summary: Use hunger cues and mindful habits to avoid overeating.
days.keyIdea: Pause before meals, eat slowly, and notice satiety signals.
faqs: Should I track hunger? Use a 1–10 scale before and after meals.
Is distraction bad? Eating away from screens improves fullness signals.

days.title: Stress Management
days.summary: Build stress relief practices that curb emotional eating.
days.keyIdea: Chronic stress elevates glucose—create a daily decompression ritual.
faqs: Quick stress tools? Try diaphragmatic breathing or short walks.
Does caffeine matter? Monitor intake—too much can spike cortisol.

days.title: Habit Stacking
days.summary: Stack new routines on existing habits for consistency.
days.keyIdea: Link keto tasks to daily anchors (coffee, commute) for reminders.
faqs: How to start? Attach one new action to a habit you already do automatically.
What if I forget? Use prompts—alarms, sticky notes, or app reminders.

days.title: Kitchen Tools
days.summary: Equip your kitchen with gadgets for faster prep.
days.keyIdea: Tools like a food scale, blender, and sheet pans streamline cooking.
faqs: Must-have tools? Sharp knives, cast-iron pan, storage containers.
Is a slow cooker worth it? Great for batch cooking low-carb stews.

days.title: Batch Cooking
days.summary: Cook once and eat many times with freezer-friendly meals.
days.keyIdea: Plan double recipes and portion into storage containers for busy days.
faqs: How often should I batch cook? Weekly or biweekly depending on schedule.
Best freezer meals? Soups, casseroles, burger patties, frittatas.

days.title: Travel Tips
days.summary: Stay on track while commuting or flying.
days.keyIdea: Pack keto-friendly snacks and research options at your destination.
faqs: Airport food ideas? Seek salads with protein, bunless burgers, cheese plates.
Hotel breakfasts? Focus on eggs, bacon, yogurt, and fruit toppings.

days.title: Long-Term Success
days.summary: Create a maintenance plan to sustain keto living.
days.keyIdea: Define maintenance carbs, plan periodic reviews, and stay flexible.
faqs: Do I ever add carbs back? Evaluate goals—some raise to maintenance range.
How often should I reassess? Monthly check-ins keep you honest.
